title: Floyd Mayweather Jr tips every chef £238 at Las Vegas restaurant

Floyd Mayweather has shown off his generous side by tipping every chef £238 at a Las Vegas restaurant.

Boxing legend Mayweather, nicknamed Money, ate at Catch Las Vegas along with 16 friends to celebrate a birthday recently.

And the 42-year-old superstar appeared to have enjoyed his meal so much that he decided to pop into the kitchen to thank the cooks personally - by handing them each $300.

An insider told Page Six : "He personally thanked everyone.

"The cooks were ecstatic and thankful!"

(Image: newcastle chronicle)

Catch describe themselves on their website as: "The go-to dining destination for celebrities from Los Angeles to New York City, CATCH is the only location to bring epic renditions of Asian-influenced sushi, seafood and steak to The Strip."

A 2.5lb Cantonese lobster at the restaurant will set a patron back $116 (£91), or if you prefer a steak there are American Wagyu Tomahawk steaks available for $195 (£153).

Meanwhile, Mayweather has reportedly abandoned plans for an exhibition fight in China in order to negotiate a rematch with Manny Pacquiao.

(Image: Splash News)

And Hong Kong's DEF Promotions director Jay Lau told The Sun : 'Mayweather came two times to Hong Kong, he spoke with my son Jayson and we had communications but now he is focusing [on] the Pacquiao rematch.

"We were talking about an exhibition in China, a big event but not a recorded professional boxing fight. Something like Mayweather vs Tenshin in Japan.

"We spoke a bit about doing a special fight in China, but halfway through he turned to the Pacquiao rematch so we stopped."

Last month the Filipino told The National : "My people are talking to his people, they’re talking to each other.

"We don’t know what the developments are, because I don’t have an update yet."
description: Floyd Mayweather Jr lived up to his nickname Money by being very generous during a trip to a Las Vegas restaurant
